div.em: Current conditions as of 19 Apr 21:55 pm CDT

div.div: A 30 percent chance of showers, mainly after 3am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 40. Light and variable wind. New precipitation amounts of less than a tenth of an inch possible.

A 30 percent chance of showers, mainly before 8am. Mostly cloudy, then gradually becoming sunny, with a high near 66. Breezy, with a light and variable wind becoming west 15 to 20 mph in the morning. Winds could gust as high as 32 mph. New precipitation amounts of less than a tenth of an inch possible.
Mostly clear, with a low around 37. Breezy, with a northwest wind 15 to 20 mph decreasing to 7 to 12 mph after midnight. Winds could gust as high as 28 mph.

font.marquee: UPDATE 4-17-2020-Riverside Community School District will close for the remainer of the 2019-2020 school year out of concern for COVID-19. All activities will be cancelled during the time of the closure.

h3.a: Update 4-17-2020-Riverside will remained closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 School Year

div.p:
Governor’s Recommendation on School Closure
In the Press Conference today 4-17-2020 -Governor Reynolds and Education Secretary Lebo announced school will remain closed for the year in Iowa. The Spring Sports Season has been cancelled. The district will need to complete and submit a Return to Learning Plan by July 1, 2020 to the Iowa Department of Education. That plan can look at Summer School . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Update 4-17-2020-Riverside will remained closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 School Year

div.p:
Riverside Community School District has been approved for Free Meals During School Closure.
Meals (Breakfast and Lunch) are available at four distribution points each Monday. If someone wants a meal delivered, please call 712-249-7312 and meals can be delivered to your home.
The cost of meals is Free . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Riverside Meal Distribution-Monday April 13, 2020

h3.a: Frequently Asked Questions for Parents and Families about Continuous Learning

div.p: This resource answers many common questions from parents and families as schools develop plans for implementing continuous learning opportunities for students. These are unusual times with unprecedented difficulty for schools, families and students. The Iowa Department of Education (Department) will continue to be diligent in our efforts to ensure we have the supports available to provide local school districts with . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Frequently Asked Questions for Parents and Families about Continuous Learning

div.p:
Riverside-Update on Event Cancellations/Postponements
Riverside Community School District will close Tuesday March 17, 2020 through Friday April 10, 2020 out of concern for COVID-19. All activities will be cancelled during the time of the closure. Return date set as Monday April 13, 2020.
March 16 - Indoor Track Meet @ ISU - Cancelled
March 17 - . . .

h3.a: Policies Regarding Anti-Bully/Anti-Harassment, Grievances, and Complaint Forms

div.p:
Policies Regarding Anti-Bully/Anti-Harassment, Grievances, and Complaint Forms
This page has all policies regarding Anti-Bullying, Anti-Harassment, Grievances, as well as Complaint Forms. If you have questions or concerns, please contact Superintendent Dr. Timothy Mitchell by phone (712-484-2212) or by email (tmitchell@riverside.k12.ia.us).
Grievance Procedure: Code No. 102.R1
Grievance Form: Code No. 102.E2
Anti-Bullying / Anti-Harassment Policy: Code No. 104
Anti-Bullying / Anti-Harassment Complaint Form: Code No. 104
Citizen Complaint Policy: Code No. 215.1
Citizen Complaint Form: Code No. 215.E
Employee Complaint Policy: Code No. 401.5
Employee Complaint Form: Code No. 401.5E
Student Complaint Policy: Code No. 502.6
Student Complaint Form: Code No. 502.6E

a.aria-label: Read more about Policies Regarding Anti-Bully/Anti-Harassment, Grievances, and Complaint Forms

div.p:
To INSPIRE so that we motivate others to bring out the best in themselves To UNIFY so that we bring others together for a common purpose or action To ACHIEVE so that others may find ways to attain a successful result
Academic Long-Range Goals
All PK-12 students will achieve at high levels in Reading Comprehension, prepared for success beyond high school. (Iowa Assessment-Spring 2019-Target 85% Advanced and Proficient) All PK-12 students will achieve at high levels in Mathematics, prepared for success beyond high school. (Iowa Assessment-Spring 2019-Target 85% Advanced and Proficient) All PK-12 students will achieve at high levels in Science, prepared for success beyond high school. (Iowa Assessment-Spring 2019-Target 85% Advanced and Proficient) All PK-12 students will achieve at high levels in Social Science, prepared for success beyond high school. (Iowa Assessment-Spring 2019-Target 85% Advanced and Proficient)

a.aria-label: Read more about District Vision, Mission and Goals

div.p:
ANNUAL/CONTINUOUS NOTICE OF NONDISCRIMINATION
The District offers career and technical programs in the following areas of study:
Agricultural, food, and natural resources Arts, communication, and information services Applied sciences, technology, engineering, and manufacturing, including transportation, distribution, logistics,architecture, and construction Business, finance, marketing and management
The Board and the District will not discriminate in educational programs on the basis of: race, creed color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, religion, disability, socioeconomic status or marital status. The Board and District will not discriminate in employment on the basis of age, race, creed, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, religion, disability or genetic information. There is a grievance procedure for processing complaints of discrimination.
Any person having inquiries concerning the District’s compliance with federal and/or state non-discrimination law is directed to:
Superintendent Dr. Timothy Mitchell
